isis.stitle: DT/DTI-466 A and B Series DT/DTI/DTA-466 C Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1993) - ENGINE PERFORMANCE ANALYSIS GUIDES - ENGINE TEST NOMENCLATURE - ENGINE SPEED (RPM)

svcproc.title: ENGINE SPEED (RPM)
svcproc.para: High idle is the highest engine speed at full throttle position and no load condition. High idle is normally 10 to 12% over engine rated speed.

Low idle is the lowest recommended speed that engine should run at no load, thus providing adequate output for mounted accessories. Below this speed, throttle control will normally start to activate engine shutoff.
